sfpowerscripts:analyze:pmd.description: This task is used to run a static analysis of the apex classes and triggers using PMD, Please ensure that the SFDX CLI and sfpowerkit plugin are installed before using this task

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

sourcedir.name: sourcedir
sourcedir.description: The directory that is to be analzed using PMD, If omitted default project diretory as mentioned in sfdx-project.json will be used

ruleset.name: ruleset
ruleset.description: Inbuilt is the default ruleset that comes with the task, If you choose custom, please provide the path to the ruleset

rulesetpath.name: rulesetpath
rulesetpath.description: The path to the ruleset if you are utilizing your own ruleset

outputpath.name: outputpath
outputpath.description: The file to which the output for static analysis will be written

version.name: version
version.description: The version of PMD to be used for static analysis

istobreakbuild.name: istobreakbuild
istobreakbuild.description: Enable this option if the build should be reported as failure if 1 or more critical defects are reported during the analysis

refname.name: refname
refname.description: Reference name to be prefixed to output variables

sfpowerscripts:apextests:trigger.description: Triggers Apex unit test in an org. Supports test level RunAllTestsInPackage, which optionally allows validation of individual class code coverage

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetorg.name: targetorg
targetorg.description: username or alias for the target org; overrides default target org

testlevel.name: testlevel
testlevel.description: The test level of the test that need to be executed when the code is to be deployed

package.name: package
package.description: Name of the package to run tests. Required when test level is RunAllTestsInPackage

validateindividualclasscoverage.name: validateindividualclasscoverage
validateindividualclasscoverage.description: Validate that individual classes have a coverage greater than the minimum required percentage coverage, only available when test level is RunAllTestsInPackage

validatepackagecoverage.name: validatepackagecoverage
validatepackagecoverage.description: Validate that the package coverage is greater than the minimum required percentage coverage, only available when test level is RunAllTestsInPackage

synchronous.name: synchronous
synchronous.description: Select an option if the tests are to be run synchronously

specifiedtests.name: specifiedtests
specifiedtests.description: comma-separated list of Apex test class names or IDs and, if applicable, test methods to run

apextestsuite.name: apextestsuite
apextestsuite.description: comma-separated list of Apex test suite names to run

coveragepercent.name: coveragepercent
coveragepercent.description: Minimum required percentage coverage, when validating code coverage

waittime.name: waittime
waittime.description: wait time for command to finish in minutes

sfpowerscripts:apextests:validate.description: Validates apex test coverage in the org, Please ensure that the SFDX CLI and sfpowerkit plugin are installed before using this task.

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetorg.name: targetorg
targetorg.description: Alias or username of the target org

testcoverage.name: testcoverage
testcoverage.description: The percentage of test coverage for apex clasess, that should be as per the last test run status

sfpowerscripts:changelog:generate.description: [BETA] Generates release changelog, providing a summary of artifact versions, work items and commits introduced in a release. Creates a release definition based on artifacts contained in the artifact directory, and compares it to previous release definition in changelog stored on a source repository

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

limit.name: limit
limit.description: limit the number of releases to display in changelog markdown

releasename.name: releasename
releasename.description: Name of the release for which to generate changelog

workitemfilter.name: workitemfilter
workitemfilter.description: Regular expression used to search for work items (user stories) introduced in release

workitemurl.name: workitemurl
workitemurl.description: Generic URL for work items. Each work item ID will be appended to the URL, providing quick access to work items

repourl.name: repourl
repourl.description: Repository in which the changelog files are located. Assumes user is already authenticated.

branchname.name: branchname
branchname.description: Repository branch in which the changelog files are located

showallartifacts.name: showallartifacts
showallartifacts.description: Show all artifacts in changelog markdown, including those that have not changed in the release

forcepush.name: forcepush
forcepush.description: Force push changes to the repository branch

sfpowerscripts:orchestrator:build.description: Build all packages (unlocked/source/data) in a repo in parallel, respecting the dependency of each packages and generate artifacts to a provided directory

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetdevhubusername.name: targetdevhubusername
targetdevhubusername.description: username or alias for the dev hub org; overrides default dev hub org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

diffcheck.name: diffcheck
diffcheck.description: Only build the packages which have changed by analyzing previous tags

gittag.name: gittag
gittag.description: Tag the current commit ID with an annotated tag containing the package name and version - does not push tag

repourl.name: repourl
repourl.description: Custom source repository URL to use in artifact metadata, overrides origin URL defined in git config

configfilepath.name: configfilepath
configfilepath.description: Path in the current project directory containing  config file for the packaging org

artifactdir.name: artifactdir
artifactdir.description: The directory where the generated artifact is to be written

waittime.name: waittime
waittime.description: Wait time for command to finish in minutes

buildnumber.name: buildnumber
buildnumber.description: The build number to be used for source packages, Unlocked Packages will be assigned the buildnumber from Saleforce directly if using .NEXT

executorcount.name: executorcount
executorcount.description: Number of parallel package task schedulors

branch.name: branch
branch.description: The git branch that this build is triggered on, Useful for metrics and general identification purposes

tag.name: tag
tag.description: Tag the build with a label, useful to identify in metrics

sfpowerscripts:orchestrator:deploy.description: Deploy packages from the provided aritfact directory, to a given org, using the order and configurable flags provided in sfdx-project.json

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetorg.name: targetorg
targetorg.description: Alias/User Name of the target environment

artifactdir.name: artifactdir
artifactdir.description: The directory containing artifacts to be deployed

waittime.name: waittime
waittime.description: Wait time for command to finish in minutes

logsgroupsymbol.name: logsgroupsymbol
logsgroupsymbol.description: Symbol used by CICD platform to group/collapse logs in the console. Provide an opening group, and an optional closing group symbol.

tag.name: tag
tag.description: Tag the deploy with a label, useful for identification in metrics

skipifalreadyinstalled.name: skipifalreadyinstalled
skipifalreadyinstalled.description: Skip the package installation if the package is already installed in the org

sfpowerscripts:orchestrator:prepare.description: Prepare a pool of scratchorgs with all the packages upfront, so that any incoming change can be validated in an optimized manner

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetdevhubusername.name: targetdevhubusername
targetdevhubusername.description: username or alias for the dev hub org; overrides default dev hub org

tag.name: tag
tag.description: The name/tag of the scratch org pool

expiry.name: expiry
expiry.description: Expiry of the scratch org's created in the pool

maxallocation.name: maxallocation
maxallocation.description: The size of the scratch org pool to be created

config.name: config
config.description: The file path to the definition file for the scratch org shape

installall.name: installall
installall.description: Install the dependencies,along with all the packages in the repo

installassourcepackages.name: installassourcepackages
installassourcepackages.description: Install all the unlocked packages as Source Packages

artifactfetchscript.name: artifactfetchscript
artifactfetchscript.description: The path to the script file that is used to fetch the validated artifacts to be used in the prepare command

succeedondeploymenterrors.name: succeedondeploymenterrors
succeedondeploymenterrors.description: Do not fail the scratch orgs, if a package failed to deploy, return the scratch org with packages till the last failure

keys.name: keys
keys.description: Keys to be used while installing any managed package dependent

batchsize.name: batchsize
batchsize.description: Number of parallel executors to be used while creating the pool

sfpowerscripts:orchestrator:promote.description: Promotes validated unlocked packages with code coverage greater than 75%

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

artifactdir.name: artifactdir
artifactdir.description: The directory where artifacts are located

devhubalias.name: devhubalias
devhubalias.description: Provide the alias of the devhub previously authenticated, default value is HubOrg if using the Authenticate Devhub task

sfpowerscripts:orchestrator:publish.description: Publish packages to an artifact registry, using a user-provided script that is responsible for authenticating & uploading to the registry.

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

artifactdir.name: artifactdir
artifactdir.description: The directory containing artifacts to be published

publishpromotedonly.name: publishpromotedonly
publishpromotedonly.description: Only publish unlocked packages that have been promoted

devhubalias.name: devhubalias
devhubalias.description: Provide the alias of the devhub previously authenticated

scriptpath.name: scriptpath
scriptpath.description: Path to script that authenticates and uploaded artifacts to the registry

tag.name: tag
tag.description: Tag the publish with a label, useful for identification in metrics

targetdevhubusername.name: targetdevhubusername

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

diffcheck.name: diffcheck
diffcheck.description: Only build the packages which have changed by analyzing previous tags

gittag.name: gittag
gittag.description: Tag the current commit ID with an annotated tag containing the package name and version - does not push tag

repourl.name: repourl
repourl.description: Custom source repository URL to use in artifact metadata, overrides origin URL defined in git config

configfilepath.name: configfilepath
configfilepath.description: Path in the current project directory containing  config file for the packaging org

artifactdir.name: artifactdir
artifactdir.description: The directory where the generated artifact is to be written

waittime.name: waittime
waittime.description: Wait time for command to finish in minutes

buildnumber.name: buildnumber
buildnumber.description: The build number to be used for source packages, Unlocked Packages will be assigned the buildnumber from Saleforce directly if using .NEXT

executorcount.name: executorcount
executorcount.description: Number of parallel package task schedulors

branch.name: branch
branch.description: The git branch that this build is triggered on, Useful for metrics and general identification purposes

tag.name: tag
tag.description: Tag the build with a label, useful to identify in metrics

sfpowerscripts:orchestrator:validate.description: Validate the incoming change against an earlier prepared scratchorg

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

pools.name: pools
pools.description: Fetch scratch-org validation environment from one of listed pools, sequentially

jwtkeyfile.name: jwtkeyfile
jwtkeyfile.description: Path to a file containing the private key

clientid.name: clientid
clientid.description: OAuth client ID, also known as the consumer key

shapefile.name: shapefile
shapefile.description: Path to .zip file of scratch org shape / metadata to deploy

coveragepercent.name: coveragepercent
coveragepercent.description: Minimum required percentage coverage for validating code coverage of packages with Apex classes

logsgroupsymbol.name: logsgroupsymbol
logsgroupsymbol.description: Symbol used by CICD platform to group/collapse logs in the console. Provide an opening group, and an optional closing group symbol.

deletescratchorg.name: deletescratchorg
deletescratchorg.description: Delete scratch-org validation environment, after the command has finished running

sfpowerscripts:package:incrementBuildNum.description: Increment the selected version counter by one and optionally commit changes to sfdx-project.json. This command does not push changes to the source repository

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

segment.name: segment
segment.description: Select the segment of the version

appendbuildnumber.name: appendbuildnumber
appendbuildnumber.description: Set the build segment of the version number to the build number rather than incremenenting

package.name: package
package.description: The name of the package of which the version need to be incremented,If not specified the default package is utilized

projectdir.name: projectdir
projectdir.description: The directory should contain a sfdx-project.json for this command to succeed

commitchanges.name: commitchanges
commitchanges.description: Mark this if you want to commit the modified sfdx-project json, Please note this will not push to the repo only commits in the local checked out repo, You would need to have a push to the repo at the end of the packaging task if everything is successfull

refname.name: refname
refname.description: Reference name to be prefixed to output variables

runnumber.name: runnumber
runnumber.description: The build number of the CI pipeline, usually available through an environment variable

sfpowerscripts:pool:delete.description: Deletes the pooled scratch orgs from the Scratch Org Pool

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetdevhubusername.name: targetdevhubusername
targetdevhubusername.description: username or alias for the dev hub org; overrides default dev hub org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

tag.name: tag
tag.description: tag used to identify the scratch org pool

mypool.name: mypool
mypool.description: Filter only Scratch orgs created by current user in the pool

allscratchorgs.name: allscratchorgs
allscratchorgs.description: Deletes all used and unused Scratch orgs from pool by the tag

inprogressonly.name: inprogressonly
inprogressonly.description: Deletes all In Progress Scratch orgs from pool by the tag

sfpowerscripts:pool:fetch.description: Gets an active/unused scratch org from the scratch org pool

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetdevhubusername.name: targetdevhubusername
targetdevhubusername.description: username or alias for the dev hub org; overrides default dev hub org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

tag.name: tag
tag.description: (required) tag used to identify the scratch org pool

sfpowerscripts:pool:list.description: Retrieves a list of active scratch org and details from any pool. If this command is run with -m|--mypool, the command will retrieve the passwords for the pool created by the user who is executing the command.

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetdevhubusername.name: targetdevhubusername
targetdevhubusername.description: username or alias for the dev hub org; overrides default dev hub org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

tag.name: tag
tag.description: tag used to identify the scratch org pool

mypool.name: mypool
mypool.description: Filter the tag for any additions created  by the executor of the command

allscratchorgs.name: allscratchorgs
allscratchorgs.description: Gets all used and unused Scratch orgs from pool

sfpowerscripts:source:deploy.description: Deploy source to org using mdapi based deploy (converts source to mdapi and use mdapi deployment)

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetorg.name: targetorg
targetorg.description: Alias or username of the target org where the code should be deployed

sourcedir.name: sourcedir
sourcedir.description: The source directory to be deployed

waittime.name: waittime
waittime.description: wait time for command to finish in minutes

checkonly.name: checkonly
checkonly.description: Validate a deployment, but don't save to the org, Use this for Stage 1/2 CI Run's

validationignore.name: validationignore
validationignore.description: Validation only deployment has issues with certain metadata such as apexttestsuite, create a different file similar to .forceignore and use it during validate only deployment

testlevel.name: testlevel
testlevel.description: The test level of the test that need to be executed when the code is to be deployed

specifiedtests.name: specifiedtests
specifiedtests.description: Specify a comma seperated values of Apex Test that need to be executed during this deployment

apextestsuite.name: apextestsuite
apextestsuite.description: Name of the Apex Test Suite that needs to be executed during this deployment

ignorewarnings.name: ignorewarnings
ignorewarnings.description: Ignores any warnings generated during metadata deployment

ignoreerrors.name: ignoreerrors
ignoreerrors.description: Ignores the deploy errors, and continues with the deploy operation

istobreakbuildifempty.name: istobreakbuildifempty
istobreakbuildifempty.description: Uncheck this field, to allow for empty folders not to break build, useful in the case of pre/post step uniformity across projects

refname.name: refname
refname.description: Reference name to be prefixed to output variables

sfpowerscripts:source:deployDestructiveM.description: Delete components in org according to destructive manifest - an empty package.xml will be automatically created, Read more about the task at  https://sfpowerscripts.com/tasks/deployment-tasks/deploy-destructive-maifest-to-an-org/

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetorg.name: targetorg
targetorg.description: Alias or username of the target org where the code should be deployed

method.name: method
method.description: If text is specified, add the members in the next field, if URL, pass in the location of the destructiveChanges.xml such as the raw git url

destructivemanifesttext.name: destructivemanifesttext
destructivemanifesttext.description: Type in the destructive manifest, follow the instructions, https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.daas.meta/daas/daas_destructive_changes.htm

destructivemanifestfilepath.name: destructivemanifestfilepath
destructivemanifestfilepath.description: The location to the xml file which contains the destructive changes

skiponmissingmanifest.name: skiponmissingmanifest
skiponmissingmanifest.description: Skip if unable to find destructive manfiest file

sfpowerscripts:package:data:create.description: Creates a versioned artifact from a source directory containing SFDMU-based data (in csv format and export json). The artifact can be consumed by release pipelines, to deploy the data to orgs

loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

versionnumber.name: versionnumber
versionnumber.description: The format is major.minor.patch.buildnumber . This will override the build number mentioned in the sfdx-project.json, Try considering the use of Increment Version Number task before this task

artifactdir.name: artifactdir
artifactdir.description: The directory where the artifact is to be written

diffcheck.name: diffcheck
diffcheck.description: Only build when the package has changed

branch.name: branch
branch.description: The git branch that this build is triggered on, Useful for metrics and general identification purposes

gittag.name: gittag
gittag.description: Tag the current commit ID with an annotated tag containing the package name and version - does not push tag

repourl.name: repourl
repourl.description: Custom source repository URL to use in artifact metadata, overrides origin URL defined in git config

refname.name: refname
refname.description: Reference name to be prefixed to output variables

repourl.name: repourl
repourl.description: Custom source repository URL to use in artifact metadata, overrides origin URL defined in git config

artifactdir.name: artifactdir
artifactdir.description: The directory where the artifact is to be written

package.name: package

targetorg.name: targetorg

package.name: package
package.description: ID (starts with 0Ho) or alias of the package to create a version of

buildartifactenabled.name: buildartifactenabled
buildartifactenabled.description: [DEPRECATED - always generate artifact] Create a build artifact, so that this pipeline can be consumed by a release pipeline

installationkeybypass.name: installationkeybypass
installationkeybypass.description: Bypass the requirement for having an installation key for this version of the package

diffcheck.name: diffcheck
diffcheck.description: Only build when the package has changed

gittag.name: gittag
gittag.description: Tag the current commit ID with an annotated tag containing the package name and version - does not push tag

repourl.name: repourl
repourl.description: Custom source repository URL to use in artifact metadata, overrides origin URL defined in git config

versionnumber.name: versionnumber

artifactdir.name: artifactdir
artifactdir.description: The directory where the artifact is to be written

enablecoverage.name: enablecoverage
enablecoverage.description: Please note this command takes a longer time to compute, activating this on every packaging build might not necessary

isvalidationtobeskipped.name: isvalidationtobeskipped
isvalidationtobeskipped.description: Skips validation of dependencies, package ancestors, and metadata during package version creation. Skipping validation reduces the time it takes to create a new package version, but package versions created without validation cant be promoted.

branch.name: branch
branch.description: The git branch that this build is triggered on, Useful for metrics and general identification purposes

package.name: package

targetorg.name: targetorg
targetorg.description: Alias/User Name of the target environment

packageinstalledfrom.name: packageinstalledfrom
packageinstalledfrom.description: automatically retrieve the version ID of the package to be installed, from the build artifact

packageversionid.name: packageversionid
packageversionid.description: manually input package version Id of the package to be installed

apexcompileonlypackage.name: apexcompileonlypackage
apexcompileonlypackage.description: Each package installation triggers a compilation of apex, flag to trigger compilation of package only

artifactdir.name: artifactdir

securitytype.name: securitytype

skiponmissingartifact.name: skiponmissingartifact

upgradetype.name: upgradetype

waittime.name: waittime
waittime.description: wait time for command to finish in minutes
